page.title: 10FARMING WORMS AND COMPOST
page.content: {Wonder Worms}produces 5 or 6 species for fishermen.They are kept in large beds of manure and fed with animal manure to which is added waste paper, card and offal.The worms are exported to many countries packed in plastic containers of peat holding 10,000 worms.They keep for three weeks.In late summer many worms are fed on pig meal,which makes them about 10 cm long and as thick as a pencil,for special fishing.In Winter the beds are covered with 30cms of straw. They bury themselves deep in the beds,lay eggs and surface in the Spring.{The Manure} containing the worms has been converted into a {high content organic {material}which is extremely valuable as compost.This is sold to garden centres and stores.
